Text.Page: You found someone's journal. The refined handwriting suggests that Hennika was an adult when she made these entries.

My belated homecoming. My old desk is covered with a thick layer of dust.
Your clothes, though a bit moth-eaten, are still neatly folded away. I gently brushed them off, and put them back on your bed.

May his soul rest in peace."Her journal is a letter to her brother.""There's more."

Detrian, I still feel like the girl I was when I was twelve.
I can still recall the anger I felt whenever I saw monsters...particularly those gulas.
But I changed over time. I hope this doesn’t sound like I'm dishonoring your memory, but I don’t think I hate monsters anymore.

I’ve seen orcans who spoke a human language. They wanted to learn how to write, they wanted to be friends with humans. They are not savages that everyone perceives them to be.

Most importantly, I saw the real face of the Valkyon Federation. I saw them slaughtering peaceful orcans. Young ones, old ones, parents, even children.
The federation sees them as nothing but animals."Hmm..."

Detrian, are we really better than monsters?
Am I better than Argog because I have smaller teeth?

Those orcans were not looking for a fight. The federation soldiers, though...they murdered the orcans in cold blood.

That was the same day I learned that I am not the only one who thinks this way.
I saw a human casting healing spells for them.

He didn’t even bat an eye when he saw Argog! The man is far from the ordinary.
I asked his name, but he said he doesn’t have one any longer.

He wants to make up for what the Valkyon Federation has done."I wonder who that man was...?"

Detrian, I finally found my true path in him.
With him, I will become common folks’ protector, like I always wanted to be.
True, the federation has done some good in the world. The hero who saved us when we were prisoners, who "almost" saved you—worked for the federation as well.

But the Valkyon Federation does not always stand for justice. People suffered, and still suffer for its wrongdoing.

I will save them in my own way.
Please have faith in me.

Damn, I miss you. Now I am a real swordfighter. I wish you were here to see me..."The guardian? She means me."
